name.text: Calculating the Depth of Water in a Cylindrical Container

questiontext.text:
A spherical container has a diameter of \({@d_sph@}\,\text{cm}\) and is \(\dfrac{4}{3}\) full of water. The water is emptied into a cylindrical container of diameter \({@d_cyl@}\,\text{cm}\). Find the depth of the water in the cylindrical container.

\(\text{The depth of the water}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Step 1: Write down the given information

Diameter of the sphere = {@d_sph@} cm

Diameter of the cylinder = {@d_cyl@} cm

Fraction of the sphere filled with water = \( \dfrac{4}{3} \)

Step 2: Find the radii of the sphere and the cylinder

\(\begin{align} r_{\text{sphere}}&=\frac{\text{Diameter}}{2}\\ &= \frac{{@d_sph@}}{2} \\ &={@r_sph@}\,\text{cm}\\ &\\ r_{\text{cylinder}} &=\frac{\text{Diameter}}{2}\\ &=\frac{{@d_cyl@}}{2} \\ &= {@r_cyl@}\,\text{cm}\\ \end{align}\)

Step 3: Find the volume of water in the sphere

\( \begin{align} V_{\text{sphere}} &=\frac{4}{3} \times \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3 \\ &= \frac{4}{3} \times \frac{4}{3}\times \frac{22}{7} \times {@r_sph@}^{3} \\ &= \frac{16}{9} \times \frac{22}{7} \times {@R_s@} \\ &=\frac{16}{9} \times{@v@}\\ &={@V_sphere@}\\ &={@v_sphere@}\,\text{cm}^3 \end{align}\)

Step 4: Write the formula for the volume of water in the cylinder

\(\begin{align} V_{\text{cylinder}} &= \pi r^2 h \\ &= \frac{22}{7} \times {@r_cyl@}^2 \times h \end{align}\)

Step 5: Equate the two volumes to find the depth of water

\(\begin{align} V_{sphere}&=V_{cylinder}\\ {@v_sphere@}&= \frac{22}{7} \times {@r_cyl@}^2 \times h\\ h &= \frac{{@v_sphere@}}{ \frac{22}{7} \times {@r_cyl@}^2}\\ &=\frac{{@v_sphere@}}{{@Cy@}}\\ &={@h@}\\ &={@depth@}\,\text{cm} \end{align}\)

Therefore,
\(\begin{align} \text{Depth of the water} &= {@depth@}\,\text{cm} \end{align}\)

questionnote.text:
\(\text{The diameter of the sphere}={@d_sph@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The diameter of the cylinder}={@d_cyl@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The volume of the sphere}={@V_sphere@}\,\text{cm}^3\)

\(\text{The height of the cylinder}={@depth@}\,\text{cm}\)
